page.title: 02Over view of Hanley Castle
page.content: Hanley Castle the smaller of the two Hanley villages is older and was mentioned in the Domesday of 1066.In those times it was famous for its castle,but sadly only knowledgeable archaeologists could trace its position today.Hanley Castle is a miniature village with a green, inn, black and white timbered cottages and a church.On one side of the green is the school which has a foundation dating back to the 14th. century,and is today a High School. Very little seems to have changed over the centuries in this picturesque village.Local and visiting artists are often seen at work during all seasons of the year,capturing this typically English scene on canvas.
